background: The objective is to maximize the total production in the last two years, taking into consideration the constraints of two different types of resources, manpower allocation, stock levels, capacities, and a limit on the total manpower available.
constraints: The consumption of InputOne per year is non-negative and within its availability
The consumption of InputTwo per year is non-negative and within its availability
Manpower allocation for ManpowerOne is non-negative and within its limit
Manpower allocation for ManpowerTwo is non-negative and within its limit
Stock levels must be maintained as per Stock non-negativity and limits
Production capacities must be respected according to Capacity
The total manpower used must not exceed the upper limit, ManpowerLimit
All variables of production, resources, and manpower must be non-negative
objective: Maximize total production in the last two years
description: Maximize total production in the last two years using the given constraints on production inputs from two resource types (\param{InputOne} and \param{InputTwo}), manpower allocations (\param{ManpowerOne} and \param{ManpowerTwo}), stock levels (\param{Stock}), capacities (\param{Capacity}), and the upper limit of manpower (\param{ManpowerLimit}).

parameters.definition: The production inputs from resource type one to product k in year j
The manpower allocated to resource type one for product k
The production inputs from resource type two to product k in year j
The manpower allocated to resource type two for product k
Stock levels of product k at the start of the planning horizon
